histogram.name: Cookie.AndroidOTRRestore
histogram.summary:
Emits when a cookie restore is attempted by Android Incognito Mode session restoration. This happens if an in-progress incognito session is killed by the system (e.g., memory pressure) and not by the user.
The enum value is true when the cookie was restored properly and false if it was rejected. Rejection should be rare as the cookies are directly written out by the system.

histogram.name: Cookie.AvgCookieJarSizePerKey
histogram.summary: Obsolete histogram as of M131, superseded by Cookie.AvgCookieJarSizePerKey2. This histogram records the average sum of the sizes of the name and value of all cookies per domain. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.AvgCookieJarSizePerKey2
histogram.summary: This histogram records the average sum of the sizes of the name and value of all cookies per domain. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.ClockSkew.ExpiredWithoutSkew
histogram.summary: For each cookie expiry, logs true if the cookie would have been expired without the addition of the skew time. Otherwise, logs false. This metric is collected during CanonicalCookie::Create() in a helper function that calculates cookie expiry.

histogram.name: Cookie.ClockSkew.{SkewDirection}
histogram.summary: For each cookie expiry, count the length of the clock skew (current_time - server_time). {SkewDirection} This metric is collected during CanonicalCookie::Create() in a helper function that calculates cookie expiry.

variant.name: AddMinutes
variant.summary: The raw clock skew value was positive or zero, so these cookies were adjusted to expire later.

variant.name: AddMinutes12To24Hours
variant.summary: The raw clock skew value was positive, so these cookies were adjusted to expire later. The range of bucket values for this metric is 720 to 1440 minutes (12 to 24 hours).

variant.name: SubtractMinutes
variant.summary: The raw clock skew value was negative, so these cookies were adjusted to expire quicker. This histogram can only record positive values, so all counts are adjusted to their positive counterparts.

variant.name: SubtractMinutes12To24Hours
variant.summary: The raw clock skew value was negative, so these cookies were adjusted to expire quicker. This histogram can only record positive values, so all counts are adjusted to their positive counterparts.The range of bucket values for this metric is 720 to 1440 minutes (12 to 24 hours).

variant.name: WithoutAddMinutesExpires
variant.summary: The raw clock skew value was positive AND the addition of these minutes caused the cookie to delay expiring until later. If this cookie was not adjusted for clock skew, it would have expired immediately.

histogram.name: Cookie.CommitProblem
histogram.summary: Recorded when a problem occurs trying to commit changes to the cookie store back to disk, in the SQLite store.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieJarSize
histogram.summary: This histogram records the sum of the sizes of the name and value of all cookies in the cookie jar. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookiePartitionSizeKibibytes
histogram.summary: This histogram records the sum of the sizes of the name and value of all cookies in a single partition of the partitioned cookie jar. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes and emits one event per partition. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookiePrefix
histogram.summary: Number of times a cookie was set with a name prefixed by "__Secure-" or "__Host-" (prefixes reserved by https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-west-cookie-prefixes).

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieSchemeRequestScheme
histogram.summary: The scheme a cookie was set by and the scheme of the request that the cookie was sent to. This is recorded once per cookie each time a URL request has its headers set.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieSourceSchemeName
histogram.summary: For each cookie added to the store, record the source URL's scheme. Schemes we're unfamiliar with will be put into the "Other Scheme" bucket.

histogram.name: Cookie.CorruptMetaTableRecovered
histogram.summary: This metric records whether the DB could be reinitialized after corruption. Note that corruption could occur due to attempting to load an unsupported variant of the cookie db (e.g., code supports v15+ and tries to load v12). If recorded as true, recovery was possible. If recorded as false, then recovery was not possible for some reason. The latter should be rare. This metric is recorded when the cookie DB is first initialized.

histogram.name: Cookie.Count2
histogram.summary: Number of cookies in the store (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time), with a wider range than Cookie.Count.

histogram.name: Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusion2.{AccessType}
histogram.summary: The SameSite attribute of a cookie whose inclusion is changed by considering redirects as part of the same-site context calculation. I.e., this is logged for cookies which are included if not considering redirects when calculating the same-site context, but are excluded (solely due to the SameSite attribute) if cross-site redirects can cause a request to be considered cross-site. This is only recorded for cookies accessed over HTTP, since redirects are not relevant for JS cookie accesses. This is logged for each cookie (whose inclusion is changed) when it is {AccessType}, regardless of whether the cookie was ultimately included.

histogram.name: Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusionAge
histogram.summary:
The age of the cookie within [0,30) minutes, rounded down to the nearest minute, whose inclusion is changed by considering redirects as part of the same-site context calculation. (See Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusion2's summary for more info.)
This is only recorded for cookies accessed via an HTTP request and is logged for each cookie whose inclusion was changed regardless of whether the cookie was ultimately included or not.

histogram.name: Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusionHttpMethod
histogram.summary:
The HTTP method of the request for the cookie whose inclusion is changed by considering redirects as part of the same-site context calculation. (See Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusion2's summary for more info.)
This is only recorded for cookies accessed over HTTP and is logged for each cookie whose inclusion was changed regardless of whether the cookie was ultimately included or not.

histogram.name: Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectType.{AccessType}
histogram.summary:
The type of redirects a cookie experienced before ultimately being accessed. This metric is triggered whenever a cookie is attempted to be accessed by an HTTP request or response. It does not matter if the access succeeds, only that one was attempted.
The metrics exists primarily to act as a denominator for Cookie.CrossSiteRedirectDowngradeChangesInclusion2.{AccessType}.

histogram.name: Cookie.DaysSinceRefreshForRetrieval
histogram.summary: Number of days since a cookie was updated, collected when cookies are loaded into memory at browser start. This is used to track how many cookies are in danger of expiring due to the proposed 400 day maximum expiration day limit.

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainHasNonASCII
histogram.summary:
Whether a site tried to set a cookie with a Domain attribute that has at least one non-ASCII character in it.
This metric is recorded everytime a cookie is created from a string (i.e. when it is set via Set-Cookie or document.cookie write), regardless of whether or not the cookie is ultimately stored.

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainSet
histogram.summary:
Was a cookie set with a Domain attribute.
This metric is recorded once per included cookie on every set attempt.

histogram.name: Cookie.DoubleUnderscorePrefixedName
histogram.summary:
Records if a cookie has a double underscore prefixed name, excluding the cookie prefixes. I.e.: __Secure- and __Host- prefixed names are ignored.
This metric is recorded every time a cookie is successfully created using CanonicalCookie::Create.

histogram.name: Cookie.EncryptedAndPlaintextValues
histogram.summary:
Records whether or not an entry in the cookie database has both encrypted and plaintext values, which should not happen.
This metric is recorded every time a cookie is parsed from the cookie database during load.

histogram.name: Cookie.ErrorInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The exact database error encountered if initializing the cookies database fails catastrophically. Initializing the cookies database happens once per network context configured with persistent cookies, so this metric could be reported multiple times from the same client. Catastrophic errors are defined in sql::IsErrorCatastrophic.

histogram.name: Cookie.Experimental.CookiesAllowedForUrlsUsage
histogram.summary: Records what types of rules are present in the CookiesAllowedForUrls policy. This policy supports content settings that only apply to the cookie's site, only apply to the top-level site, and rules that apply to both. This histogram is recorded when the CookiesAllowedForUrls policy is first loaded. Only recorded when the policy contains at least one valid rule.

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDuration400DaysGT
histogram.summary: Number of days until a cookie expires when set (for values over the rfc6265bis limit of 400 days).

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDuration400DaysLTE
histogram.summary: Number of days until a cookie expires when set (for values under or equal to the rfc6265bis limit of 400 days).

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDurationMinutesNonSecure
histogram.summary: Number of minutes until non-Secure cookie expires when set.

histogram.name: Cookie.ExpirationDurationMinutesSecure
histogram.summary: Number of minutes until Secure cookie expires when set.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartyPartitioned.HasCrossSiteAncestor
histogram.summary: This histogram records the presence/absence of a cross-site ancestor when a first-party Partitioned cookie is accessed. This metric is recorded each time the IncludeForRequestURL method is called on a CanonicalCookie that is first-party partitioned.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.ComponentSetsNonfatalErrors
histogram.summary:
This histogram keeps count of how many First-Party Sets are not successfully parsed while initializing the First-Party Sets component, but do not cause a fatal error.
This metric is recorded by the FirstPartySetParser when it has successfully finished processing all sets from its input stream, as passed by the FirstPartySetsLoader.
The metric is recorded during the startup of each client if it was able to process the whole component without encountering a fatal error. It will be recorded at most once each time the client starts up.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.ComponentSetsParsedSuccessfully
histogram.summary:
This histogram keeps count of how many First-Party Sets are successfully parsed while initializing the First-Party Sets component.
This metric is recorded by the FirstPartySetParser when it has succesfully finished processing all sets from its input stream, as passed by the FirstPartySetsLoader.
The metric is recorded during the startup of each client if it was able to process the whole component without encountering a fatal error. It will be recorded at most once each time the client starts up.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.ContextDelayedQueriesCount
histogram.summary:
The number of queries that were delayed for a browser context (i.e. answered asynchronously instead of synchronously).
Recorded once per profile during log-in when the First-Party Sets info is ready for the network context if feature WaitForFirstPartySetsInit was enabled.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.ContextMostDelayedQueryDelta
histogram.summary:
The length of time between when the first asynchronous query was received, and when asynchronous queries started to be answered for a browser context.
Recorded once per profile profile during log-in when the First-Party Sets info is ready in the network context if feature WaitForFirstPartySetsInit was enabled.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.EnqueueingDelay.{QueryType}
histogram.summary:
The amount of time an asynchronous {QueryType} query was delayed before it was answered.
Recorded once for each query that is answered asynchronously, when the callback is invoked. Recorded for all clients, even those with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.FindOwner.Latency
histogram.summary:
This histogram records the (TimeTicks) latency of computing the owner of a given domain.
This metric is sampled every time an owner is computed. (E.g., a single time when computing a partition key involving First-Party Sets; multiple times when computing a SamePartyContext.) Only sampled for users with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.InitializationDuration.{Landmark}2
histogram.summary:
The amount of time taken until {Landmark} during First-Party Sets initialization. Each sample is measured starting from the moment the FirstPartySets instance is constructed.
Each metric is recorded once when the First-Party Sets objects are initialized in the Network Service. (Note that this may happen multiple times during a single Chrome session, if the Network Service crashes and restarts.) Recorded for all clients, even those with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.ProcessedEntireComponent
histogram.summary:
This histogram tracks whether the First-Party Sets component was able to process all sets while starting up, or if it had to abort during the process due to encountering a fatal error.
The metric will be recorded at most once each time the client starts up.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.{Context}.DelayedQueriesCount
histogram.summary:
The number of queries that were delayed (i.e. answered asynchronously instead of synchronously).
Recorded once during initialization, for each context. (This means once per browser-run in the browser process; and once each time the Network Service is started.) The metric is emitted even when First-Party Sets is disabled.

histogram.name: Cookie.FirstPartySets.{Context}.MostDelayedQueryDelta
histogram.summary:
The length of time between when the first asynchronous query was received, and when asynchronous queries started to be answered.
Recorded once during initialization, for each context. (This means once per browser-run in the browser process; and once each time the Network Service is started.) Recorded for all clients, even those with low-resolution clocks.
If the context was initialized before any queries were made (including if the feature is disabled entirely), 0 is recorded.

histogram.name: Cookie.FromStorageWithValidLength
histogram.summary: If a canonical cookie has a valid name+value length. Logged whenever a cookie is created FromStorage and if this cookie IsCanonical.

histogram.name: Cookie.HasNonASCII.{CookieField}
histogram.summary: If a cookie's {CookieField} field contains a non-ASCII character. Informally, this indicates if the field contains a (non-ASCII) Unicode character. Logged whenever a cookie is created via CanonicalCookie::Create().

histogram.name: Cookie.IncludedRequestEffectiveSameSite
histogram.summary: The value of the effective samesite for cookies that will be included in a request. Logged once per successful inclusion.

histogram.name: Cookie.IncludedResponseEffectiveSameSite
histogram.summary: The value of the effective samesite for cookies that will be accepted from a response. Logged once per successful inclusion.

histogram.name: Cookie.IsPartitionedValid
histogram.summary: If a cookie line contains the Partitioned attribute, this histogram logs whether it was used correctly (must have a __Host- prefix and must not have the SameParty attribute). Logged whenever a cookie is created from a string (from a Set-Cookie header or a write to document.cookie).

histogram.name: Cookie.LoadProblem
histogram.summary: Recorded when a problem is recorded when loading the persistent cookie store. Value 5 was added in M96. Values 6 and 7 were added in M131.

histogram.name: Cookie.MaxCookieJarSizePerKey
histogram.summary: This histogram records the maximum sum of the sizes of the name and value of all cookies that a single domain is using. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.MaxSameSiteNoneCookiesPerKey
histogram.summary: Maximum number of SameSite=None cookies that belong to a single domain on the client. This histogram will be used to inform the per-partition-per-domain limit for partitioned cookies. Recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time.

histogram.name: Cookie.NameOrValueHtab
histogram.summary:
Records whether or not a cookie has internal HTABs in either its name or value. Leading and trailing HTABs are ignored.
This metric is recorded every time CanonicalCookie::Create is called, regardless whether the cookie is successfully created or not.

histogram.name: Cookie.NumKeys
histogram.summary: Records the number of distinct keys (eTLD+1's) that have any stored cookies (which may or may not be expired). Recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time.

histogram.name: Cookie.OnCookiesAccessed.BatchSize
histogram.summary: Records the number of cookie access details batches received in RenderFrameHostImpl. Recorded every time accesses are reported from the network service.

histogram.name: Cookie.OnCookiesAccessed.TotalAccesses
histogram.summary: Records the number of cookie access details received in RenderFrameHostImpl. Recorded every time accesses are reported from the network service.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionCount
histogram.summary: This histogram records the number of cookie jar partitions. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled. This count does not include the unpartitioned cookie jar. Only counts cookie jar partitions with at least one cookie. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionedCookieCount
histogram.summary: This histogram records the number of cookies in the partitioned cookie jar. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionedCookieCount.{NonceType}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the number of partitioned cookies whose partition key is {NonceType}. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionedCookieJarSizeKibibytes
histogram.summary: This histogram records the size of the names and values of all cookies in the partitioned cookie jar. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionedCookieJarSizeKibibytes.{NonceType}
histogram.summary: This histogram records the size of the names and values of all cookies in the partitioned cookie jar, only counting {NonceType} partitions. This metric is only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.PartitionedCookiesInRequest
histogram.summary: This histogram records the number of partitioned cookies in requests. Only recorded when partitioned cookies are enabled to reduce noise.

histogram.name: Cookie.PerFirstPartySetCount
histogram.summary: This histogram records, for each (nontrivial) First-Party Set, the number of cookies in the cookie store that belong to a member or owner of that set. Recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time.

histogram.name: Cookie.Port.OmniboxURLNavigation.Localhost
histogram.summary:
The port of the destination for a URL omnibox navigation when the destination is localhost. Excludes navigations that are effectively reloads. Also does not take into account any redirects that destination URL may do before finally serving a page. In other words, it's the port of the first request in a possible chain. Note that the effective port is recorded which includes the default port, so if https://google.com is typed then 443 will be recorded.
Cookie.Port.OmniboxURLNavigation.RemoteHost records the non-localhost version of this histogram.
While the intent of this histogram is to inform cookie related design decisions, the metric itself does not depend on cookies being sent or set.

histogram.name: Cookie.Port.OmniboxURLNavigation.RemoteHost
histogram.summary:
The port of the destination for a URL omnibox navigation when the destination is anything but localhost. Excludes navigations that are effectively reloads. Also does not take into account any redirects that destination URL may do before finally serving a page. In other words, it's the port of the first request in a possible chain. Note that the effective port is recorded which includes the default port, so if https://google.com is typed then 443 will be recorded.
Cookie.Port.OmniboxURLNavigation.Localhost records the localhost version of this histogram.
While the intent of this histogram is to inform cookie related design decisions, the metric itself does not depend on cookies being sent or set.

histogram.name: Cookie.Port.Read.{HostType}
histogram.summary:
This is the port a cookie is being read by: For network access via HTTP(S) this value is the port of the origin the request is being sent to. For script access via non-HTTP APIs this is the value of the port of the origin of the frame the read call is made in.
The "Localhost" variant of this metric is recorded only for localhost origns. The "RemoteHost" variant is recorded for all other origins.
This metric is recorded once per included cookie on every read attempt.

histogram.name: Cookie.Port.ReadDiffersFromSet.{HostType}
histogram.summary:
This records if a cookie is being read by the same port value that set it (the source port). See Cookie.Port.Set.* and Cookie.Port.Read.* for more information on how the port value for setting and reading (respectively) is obtained.
If the source port is unspecified (due to a cookie already existing before we started to record this value) or invalid (due to corruption) then this metric does not check for destination port equivalency.
The "Localhost" variant of this metric is recorded only for localhost origns. The "RemoteHost" variant is recorded for all other origins. The "DomainSet" variant of this metric is recorded for all cookies which have the Domain attribute set (localhost and IP addresses cannot set the Domain attribute and therefore will not trigger this metric. Put technically, the origin must have a non-empty registrable domain to set the Domain attribute).
This metric is recorded once per included cookie on every read attempt.

histogram.name: Cookie.Port.Set.{HostType}
histogram.summary:
This is the port a cookie is being set by: For network access via HTTP(S) this value is the port of the origin the response is being received from. For script access via non-HTTP APIs this is the value of the port of the origin of the frame the set call is made in.
The "Localhost" variant of this metric is recorded only for localhost origns. The "RemoteHost" variant is recorded for all other origins.
This metric is recorded once per included cookie on every set attempt. This includes expired cookies which are immediately deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.RequestSameSiteContext
histogram.summary: The same-site context of a request, i.e. the relationship between the request and the navigational environment. Logged on every request to access a cookie.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteAttributeValue
histogram.summary: The value of the cookie's SameSite attribute, if any. This is logged once per created cookie, upon parsing of the SameSite attribute from a string.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteNoneSizeBytes
histogram.summary: Size of SameSite=None cookies in bytes. Counted whenever a cookie is set via CookieMonster::SetCanonicalCookie.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteNoneSizeBytes.{IsPartitioned}
histogram.summary: Size of SameSite=None {IsPartitioned} cookies in bytes. Counted whenever a cookie is set via CookieMonster::SetCanonicalCookie.

histogram.name: Cookie.ScriptAgeSinceLastUpdateInHoursGTOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a non-session cookie written by a script and being loaded for some context is (for values greater than one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store.

histogram.name: Cookie.ScriptAgeSinceLastUpdateInHoursLTEOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a non-session cookie written by a script and being loaded for some context is (for values less than or equal to one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store.

histogram.name: Cookie.ScriptExpirationInHoursGTOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours in the future a non-session cookie being set via JavaScript wants to expire (for values greater than to one week). Recorded when the cookie is stored via script.

histogram.name: Cookie.ScriptExpirationInHoursLTEOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours in the future a non-session cookie being set via JavaScript wants to expire (for values less than or equal to one week). Recorded when the cookie is stored via script.

histogram.name: Cookie.SessionAgeInHoursGTOneWeek2
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a session cookie being loaded for some context is (for values greater than one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store.

histogram.name: Cookie.SessionAgeInHoursLTEOneWeek2
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a session cookie being loaded for some context is (for values less than or equal to one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store.

histogram.name: Cookie.SessionAgeSinceLastUpdateInHoursGTOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a session cookie being loaded for some context is (for values greater than one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store. Unlike Cookie.SessionAgeInHoursGTOneWeek this metric records the time since the last refresh (if any) instead of initial creation.

histogram.name: Cookie.SessionAgeSinceLastUpdateInHoursLTEOneWeek
histogram.summary: Number of hours old a session cookie being loaded for some context is (for values less than or equal to one week). Recorded when cookies are loaded from the store. Unlike Cookie.SessionAgeSinceLastUpdateInHoursLTEOneWeek this metric records the time since the last refresh (if any) instead of initial creation.

histogram.name: Cookie.SourceType
histogram.summary: For each cookie added to the store, record the source that wrote it. This helps understand the balance of cookies written by HTTP Headers, JavaScript, etc.

histogram.name: Cookie.StaleSessionCookiesDeletedOnStartup
histogram.summary:
Records the amount of stale (7 days since last access or update) session cookies deleted by SessionRestore after tabs have been restored on browser startup.
See crbug.com/40285083 for more info.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeBlockedOnLoad
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) between the cookie store load starting and completing.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV19
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v18 cookie database to v19. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v18 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV20
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v19 cookie database to v20. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v19 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV21
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v20 cookie database to v21. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v20 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV22
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v21 cookie database to v22. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v21 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV23
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v22 cookie database to v23. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v22 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV24
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v23 cookie database to v24. Migration occurs upon first startup of a browser version with v23 database code.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to initialize the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeOpsBlockedDueToGlobalOp
histogram.summary:
The amount of time (ms) cookie operations are blocked due to a global operation happening on startup. 0 if this didn't happen.
Recorded after all cookies finished loading from disk for a given cookie store.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeToRecordPeriodicStats
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to record periodic statistics for logging. This metric is recorded every 10 minutes.

histogram.name: Cookie.Type2
histogram.summary: For each cookie added to the store, record it's type(s). A new enumeration value, Persistent, was added in M125.

histogram.name: Cookie.WinGetLastErrorInitializeDB
histogram.summary: The result of calling ::GetLastError if initializing the cookies database fails catastrophically. Initializing the cookies database happens once per network context configured with persistent cookies, so this metric could be reported multiple times from the same client. Catastrophic errors are defined in sql::IsErrorCatastrophic. This metric is only reported on Windows.
